comment.author: 29079609@N02
comment._content: you can still see her today Built in 1904 (!) in Budapest she became part of K.u.K. Danube flottila as SMS Bodrog. She was river monitor of Temes class. (according) To some info fired first shots in the Great war. Damaged at the beggining of the world war 1 near Beograd, repaired and served trough entire war. www.shipspotting.com/gallery/photo.php?lid=695339 and check out the tricked out funnels in this film footage! filmhiradok.nava.hu/watch.php?id=5266 it appears she is being rebuilt, according to the monitor forum www.worldnavalships.com/forums/showthread.php?p=10013206

comment.author: 76016463@N00
comment._content: This is the "Sava" River, which is a major regional river in the former Yugoslavia. en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sava

comment.author: 34911459@N08
comment._content: Thank you for the background information on the Bodrog.  We may update the record to correctly identify the river.
